event: Early human ancestors inhabit the Iberian Peninsula
Neolithic and Bronze Age cultures develop across Iberia
Phoenician and Greek trading colonies are established
Iberian and Celtiberian cultures dominate much of the peninsula
Roman conquest of Iberia begins during the Punic Wars
Roman Hispania is fully incorporated into the Roman Empire
Roman cities, roads, and law shape Iberian society
Germanic invasions weaken Roman control
Visigothic Kingdom emerges with Toledo as a center
Muslim forces begin the conquest of Iberia
Umayyad Emirate of Córdoba is established
Caliphate of Córdoba marks peak of Islamic Spain
Caliphate collapses into rival taifa kingdoms
Christian forces capture Toledo during the Reconquista
Battle of Las Navas de Tolosa turns tide against Muslim rule
Marriage of Ferdinand and Isabella unites major Spanish crowns
Granada falls, completing the Reconquista
Columbus’s voyage begins Spanish expansion overseas
Spain emerges as a major European and global power
Defeat of the Spanish Armada weakens naval dominance
War of Spanish Succession reshapes European balance
Bourbon dynasty centralizes the Spanish state
Napoleonic invasion sparks resistance and reform
Liberal constitution is proclaimed in Cádiz
Most Spanish colonies in the Americas gain independence
Spain loses its last major overseas colonies
Spanish Civil War begins
Authoritarian regime is established after civil war
Democratic constitution establishes modern Spain
